inlineContent.text: An example of an initializer is
The body is optional because this node also represents initializer requirements inside protocols.

abstract.text: Modifiers that are attached to the initializer declaration.
Attributes that are attached to the initializer.
If the initializer is failable, a question mark to indicate that.
The initializer’s body. Missing if the initializer is a requirement of a protocol declaration.
The parameter clause that defines the generic parameters.
clause that places additional constraints on generic parameters like
Provide common functionality for specialized syntax nodes. Extend this
protocol to provide common functionality for all syntax nodes.
If the initializer had generic parameters, a where clause that can restrict those.
Syntax nodes that have generic parameters.
The arguments of the initializer. While the function signature allows specifying a return clause, doing so is not semantically valid.
A list of attributes that can be attached to a declaration.
Protocol that provides a common Hashable implementation for all syntax nodes
The statically allowed structure of the syntax node.
Converts the given specialized node to this type. Returns
A convenience initializer that allows initializing syntax collections using result builders
